extendedInfo.description: This application is a set of logic, math, geometry, number, matchstick and other types of brain teasers that require logical thinking. All the puzzles and riddles are available in English, Russian, Chinese, Czech and Slovak language.Sample brain teaser:There are three switches downstairs. Each corresponds to one of the three light bulbs in the attic. You can turn the switches on and off and leave them in any position. How would you identify which switch corresponds to which light bulb, if you are only allowed one trip upstairs?Answer:Keep the first bulb switched on for a few minutes. It gets warm, right? So all you have to do then is switch it off and switch another bulb on. Then walk into the room with bulbs, touch them and tell which one was switched on as the first one (the warm one). The others can be easily identified :-)This and all other brain teasers and pictures are provided by http://brainden.com/puzzles-riddles.htm where you can find other puzzles as well.Thank you all for your comments and suggestions which helped to add interactivity to the water brain teasers (pour water in several containers to achieve certain amount water in 1 specific container). More interactive games will be added shortly. If you are interested in helping with translation into Spanish, your own language, or if you have any other suggestion to improve this app then don't hesitate to send me an email to chilleddev@gmail.com.Permissions usage explanation:android.permission.INTERNET - loading online content (unsolved teasers)android.permission.ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE - loading online content (unsolved teasers)

reviews.title: Fun but..
reviews.comment: Flawed logic in the reasoning problem \"stamps\". There\'s no way to know what person B had because the grand master still has 2 stamps in his pocket. Persons A and C could both have had 1 green and 1 red stamp. Because there are still 4  stamps unknown to person B, he would only stand a 1 in 3 chance of guessing correctly. If the grand master had 2 green stamps in his pocket, person B could guess 2 reds on his forehead and be correct.
reviews.author: Patrick Osborne
